title: Fix keyboard input deselection bug in Add New Product modal

requirements.text: Fix the 'Add New Product' modal in AdminDashboardPage.tsx so that typing in any input field (Name, SKU, Description, Price, Stock, Image URL) does not cause the field to lose focus or deselect. The root cause is likely that the form state update on each keystroke triggers a re-render that unmounts and remounts the input, or that the modal/overlay component re-renders and steals focus. Ensure all controlled inputs use stable onChange handlers (e.g., useCallback or defined outside render) and that the modal's open/close state does not re-initialize form state on every keystroke. All form fields must remain focused and accept continuous keyboard input without deselection.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking into any input field in the 'Add New Product' modal and typing multiple characters keeps the field focused throughout.
No deselection or focus loss occurs after entering any character in Name, SKU, Description, Price, Stock, or Image URL fields.
The form state correctly reflects all typed characters without resetting or losing intermediate values.
The modal does not re-mount or flicker when typing in any field.
Submitting the form with fully typed values works correctly.

constraints: Do not change the visual design or layout of the 'Add New Product' modal.
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui.
nonGoals: Adding new fields to the Add New Product form.
Changing backend product schema or canister logic.
Fixing any other page or form outside the Admin Dashboard Add New Product modal.
